alert.note: Alert for Cobb; Douglas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:40PM EST until January 12 at 3:32AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Sweetwater Creek at Brownsville at Powder Springs affecting Cobb and Paulding Counties. Sweetwater Creek near Austell affecting Cobb and Douglas Counties. For the Sweetwater Creek...including Powder Springs, Powder Springs, Austell, Powder Springs, Austell, Austell, Sweetwater Creek below Austell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sweetwater Creek near Austell. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Significant flooding occurs in the woodlands and fields upstream and downstream from the gage near the Interstate 20 bridge. Portions of a paintball playing field just downstream of the bridge and athletic fields in the Woodrow Wilson Park on Mount Vernon Road are flooded with 2 to 3 feet of water. Water begins to flood a few mobile homes on Brook Forest Road and homes on Wren Circle in Douglas County. Portions of Sunlight Drive in Cobb County will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.3 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 12.9 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 10 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1045 AM EST.
